form.label: Panel-defined search driven by select drop down

div.h1: Simple XML - Multi-panel linked form search driven by select dropdown
div.p: This form search dispatches four separate searches in the four panels, each listening to the common 'sourcetypeToken' specified by the dropdown list. This is useful for a page that groups together disparate form searches that share a common search keyword/token.
Note: because this page dispatches multiple searches, the JobStatus bar does not appear.
<searchTemplate> specified for each panel. Each panel pipes the results to a different time chart.
div.div:
<searchTemplate>
index=_internal source=*metrics.log group="per_sourcetype_thruput"
series="$sourcetypeToken$" | timechart sum(kb)
</searchTemplate>
<searchTemplate>
index=_internal source=*metrics.log group="per_sourcetype_thruput"
series="$sourcetypeToken$" | timechart avg(eps)
</searchTemplate>
<searchTemplate>
index=_internal source=*metrics.log group="per_sourcetype_thruput"
series="$sourcetypeToken$" | timechart max(eps)
<searchTemplate>
index=_internal source=*metrics.log group="per_sourcetype_thruput"
series="$sourcetypeToken$" | timechart avg(ebps)
</searchTemplate>
div.p: The common search input used by all panels:

div.pre:
<input type="dropdown" token="sourcetype">
<label>Sourcetype</label> <suffix>*</suffix>
<populatingSearch fieldForValue="series" fieldForLabel="series" earliest="-60m"> index=_internal source=*metrics.log group="per_sourcetype_thruput" | chart count over series </populatingSearch>
</input>
